definition: to mash/to beat to a pulp

sentences.english: But pounding isn't as good as cooking that steak, says Wrangham.
sentences.chinese: 但搗爛的牛排並不如烹調的牛排那樣好，阮格漢姆說。

sentences.english: The cooked soybeans are smashed in the pot.
sentences.chinese: 煮熟的黃豆在鍋裏直接被搗爛。

sentences.english: Take a family-size packet of chocolate cookies. Mash them down the back seats.
sentences.chinese: 拿一袋家庭裝的巧克力餅乾，在後座上搗爛。

sentences.english: You can help mash up the potatoes for me.
sentences.chinese: 你可以幫我把馬鈴薯搗爛。

sentences.english: Burn treatment, amount of fresh calla lily tubers, mash and external application.
sentences.chinese: 治燙傷，鮮馬蹄蓮塊莖適量，搗爛外敷。

sentences.english: Repeat with the second half of the rosemary and lavender, again adding a little oil for crushing.
sentences.chinese: 然後重複剛纔的步驟把剩下的迷迭香和薰衣草也搗爛。

sentences.english: Who mashes up crayons and rubs them in their hair?
sentences.chinese: 誰搗爛了蠟筆還用它們摩擦頭髮？

definition: to dry over a fire/to roast
black atractylodes rhizome (dried rhizome of any of several atractylodes species) (TCM)
mole cricket/Gryllolaptaptidae, family of burrowing insects of order Orthoptera (a serious agricultural pest)
liquorice (Sophora flavescens), with roots used in TCM
dwarf lilyturf (Ophiopogon japonicus), its tuber used in TCM
